question: Why may a confined space be dangerous to work in?

options.label: A
options.text: There may not be sufficient working space

options.label: B
options.text: Air in the space may be unbreathable due to poisonous gas

options.label: C
options.text: Temperature and poor ventilation may affect the worker

options.label: D
options.text: All of the hazards mentioned

question: What must be considered first when planning to carry out work in a confined space?

options.label: A
options.text: Has the job been priced properly

options.label: B
options.text: Have the correct tools been arranged

options.label: C
options.text: Has sufficient manpower been allocated

options.label: D
options.text: Can the work be done from the outside

question: When working in a confined space, such as a sewer, what danger may occur?

options.label: A
options.text: Getting wet through

options.label: B
options.text: Boredom

options.label: C
options.text: Not enough time for the job to be done

options.label: D
options.text: Build-up of harmful gases

question: To determine the safety of the atmosphere in an excavation, which of the following is essential?

options.label: A
options.text: Sniffing the atmosphere after entry

options.label: B
options.text: Using a gas detector

options.label: C
options.text: Only entering for a short period to enable a quick escape

options.label: D
options.text: Looking for toxic gases

question: Before entering an excavation to start work, it must first be:

options.label: A
options.text: Inspected by a competent person

options.label: B
options.text: Covered over and left overnight

options.label: C
options.text: Filled with water then drained

options.label: D
options.text: Inspected by the HSE

question: What is the purpose of using a ‘permit to work’ system?

options.label: A
options.text: To ensure the job is carried out by the quickest method

options.label: B
options.text: To help ensure a safe system of work

options.label: C
options.text: To ensure that the client will pay for the work

options.label: D
options.text: To enable tools and equipment to be properly checked before the commencement of work

question: Why may young people be more at risk on site?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no specific legislation applying to them

options.label: B
options.text: They are usually left to work alone to gain experience

options.label: C
options.text: There is no requirement to provide PPE to young people

options.label: D
options.text: They are inexperienced and may not recognise danger

question: You have to enter a manhole in which you know there are toxic gases. You have all the PPE but there does not appear to be a rescue plan in place. What should you do?

options.label: A
options.text: Just get on and do the job, it will probably be alright

options.label: B
options.text: Plan to carry out the job in short bursts

options.label: C
options.text: Do not enter the manhole until a rescue plan and rescue equipment are in place

options.label: D
options.text: Ask your mate to stand-by at the top of the manhole with a length of rope

question: You have to enter a manhole in which you believe there could be toxic gases. You have not been provided with any Respiratory Protective Equipment (RPE). What should you do?

options.label: A
options.text: Tell your supervisor that you will need RPE, and if necessary, training in confined space working

options.label: B
options.text: Sniff the atmosphere in the manhole to see if you can smell harmful gases

options.label: C
options.text: Look into the manhole to see if you can see any harmful gases

options.label: D
options.text: Just get on with the job, and accept the risks

question: While digging a trench, you uncover a length of yellow marker tape at a depth of about 150mm. What does the presence of the marker tape mean?

options.label: A
options.text: The area has a high water-table and precautions must be taken to prevent an in-rush of water

options.label: B
options.text: There is a buried electrical cable and further excavation must be carried out with care

options.label: C
options.text: There is contaminated soil below the level of the marker tape and all excavation must stop

options.label: D
options.text: The excavation has reached a depth where the sides must now be supported

question: A Cable Avoidance Tool (C.A.T.) and a ‘Genny’ (generator) can be used successfully to locate underground cables by whom:

options.label: A
options.text: Anyone

options.label: B
options.text: A competent person after training

options.label: C
options.text: Any electricity company employee

options.label: D
options.text: The site foreman

question: When exposing underground power cables, which method of excavation should you use?

options.label: A
options.text: A 360 degree excavator with rubber tyres

options.label: B
options.text: A pickaxe

options.label: C
options.text: Hand digging

options.label: D
options.text: A kango hammer

question: When do special precautions need to be taken when working near overhead electric power lines?

options.label: A
options.text: Only if cranes etc. are being used

options.label: B
options.text: Only if someone could touch a line with their bare hands

options.label: C
options.text: Only if plant has to pass under the lines

options.label: D
options.text: Whenever work areas will be near or beneath the lines

options.label: A
options.text: Make sure someone responsible knows where you are

options.label: B
options.text: You can do away with protective equipment

options.label: C
options.text: Don’t bother anyone if you have a problem, always sort it out yourself

question: You have to walk across a site several times a day, but have to dodge a lot of site traffic. The first thing you should do is:

options.label: A
options.text: Have a word with the drivers

options.label: B
options.text: Walk around the edges of the site to keep out of the way

options.label: C
options.text: Tell your supervisor about the danger

options.label: D
options.text: Jump on the back of a vehicle if you can, it’s safer than walking

question: A mobile plant operator can let you ride in the machine:

options.label: A
options.text: If you have a long way to go

options.label: B
options.text: If it is raining

options.label: C
options.text: If it is designed to carry passengers

options.label: D
